conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to determine the acceleration of the cargo when it is placed on the conveyor and the time it takes to travel from the left end to the right end.
When the cargo is placed on the conveyor, it experiences a frictional force due to the difference in speed between the conveyor and the cargo.

premise: The frictional force is given by f = μ1 N where μ1 is the kinetic friction coefficient and N is the normal force. Since the cargo is on a horizontal conveyor, the normal force N is equal to the weight of the cargo mg.

conclusion: The acceleration a of the cargo due to this frictional force is a = f/m = μ1 g

premise: Given μ1 = 0.2 and g = 10 m/s^2, a = μ1 g
The cargo accelerates until it reaches the speed of the conveyor v0 = 2 m/s. The time t1 to reach this speed can be found using the equation v0 = a t1
The distance d1 traveled by the cargo during this acceleration phase can be found using the equation d1 = 1/2 a t1^2
After reaching the conveyor speed, the cargo moves with constant speed v0. The remaining distance d2 to be covered is d2 = L1 - d1
The time t2 to cover this distance at constant speed is t2 = d2/v0
The total time t to travel from the left end to the right end is the sum of t1 and t2
